p: Bat flights are generally short distances for the purpose of foraging, hunting, changing roost sites or social behaviour. Indeed, the majority of bat species in the world are sedentary. Some bats, however, particularly those in the temperate regions of the world, perform annual long distance flights [ 145]. Bat migration typically occurs along rivers, as shown for bats in Poland and central Slovakia [ 57, 146] and tends to avoid mountainous areas [ 146].
